result.execSummary:
The defendant Detrick J. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 50 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court WAIVED all costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Detrick J. Smith

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Court sentenced the Defendant to serve 50 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 50 DAYS time served. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court WAIVED all costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court advised Defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

PreTrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; received and filed.

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense counsel and Defendant. State advised the Court they have complied with victim notification.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived his rights. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements; received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain Defendant's plea. Court found Defendant Guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED BUT READ-IN for the purpose of Sentencing.

Defendant Detrick J. Smith in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered charge AMENDED to THEFT (VALUE NOT EXCEEDING $2,500), contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.20(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Detrick J. Smith in court with attorney Thomas K Hackbart.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: CFL.
Case set for Further proceedings. Parties addressed the defendants status. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date. Court granted the defense request. Case calendared in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas K Hackbart in court, defendant Detrick J. Smith not in court, in custody.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for further proceedings. For reasons placed on the record, matter adjourned for further proceedings. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 45.  
Further proceedings scheduled for April 4, 2018 at 08:30 am.
